# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line * "\n")
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello world. This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function splits the text into words using `split` and then iterates over each word, adding it to the current line unless the line length plus the length of the word would exceed the specified `text_width`. If that's the case, a new line is started. Finally, all lines are joined back together with newline characters between them.
